आपण "गोळीबार छाटणी"च्या उत्पादनाबद्दल योग्य माहिती दिली आहे. यामध्ये काही महत्त्वाचे मुद्दे आहेत:

1. **पिकाची अवस्था**: सध्या आपले पिक "Shoot Development" अवस्थेत आहे, ज्यामुळे उत्पादन कमी असू शकते. या अवस्थेत पिकाची वाढ होत असते, आणि उत्पादनाची अपेक्षा कमी असू शकते.

2. **पाण्याचे नियोजन**: पाण्याचे योग्य नियोजन महत्त्वाचे आहे. पाण्याचे प्रमाण आणि वेळ यावर उत्पादनावर प्रभाव पडतो.

3. **कीड आणि रोग**: पिकांमध्ये कीड किंवा रोगांचा प्रादुर्भाव असल्यास, उत्पादन कमी होऊ शकते. यासाठी नियमितपणे निरीक्षण करणे आवश्यक आहे.

4. **हवामान**: हवामानातील बदल, जसे की कमी पाऊस किंवा जास्त तापमान, यामुळे उत्पादनावर परिणाम होऊ शकतो.

आपण या मुद्द्यांवर लक्ष देऊन आपल्या पिकांचे उत्पादन वाढवू शकता. जर आपल्याला अधिक माहिती किंवा सल्ला हवे असल्यास, कृपया सांगा.
मला खूप शंका आहे तरी पण एक तिकीट तयार करून द्या

messages.content:
आपल्या शंकांसाठी एक तिकीट तयार केले आहे. येथे काही महत्त्वाचे मुद्दे आहेत:

### तिकीट: उत्पादन कमी येण्याची शंका

**प्लॉटचे नाव**: Sudhakar Plot 1  
**स्थान**: Pimpalnare, Dindori, Nashik, Maharashtra  
**पिकाचे नाव**: Grapes  
**सध्याची अवस्था**: Shoot Development (सुरूवात: 4 ऑक्टोबर 2024)  
**सध्या आठवडा**: 1

#### सध्याचे फर्टिगेशन शेड्यूल:
- **फोलिअर पद्धतीने**:
  - **फेरस सल्फेट**: 800 ग्रॅम/एकर
  - **मॅंगनीज सल्फेट**: 800 ग्रॅम/एकर
  - **सूचना**: फोलिअर स्प्रेमध्ये सूक्ष्म पोषण तत्वांचा एकाग्रता 1% पेक्षा जास्त नसावा (उदाहरणार्थ, 500 लिटर पाण्यात 5 किलो).

- **फर्टिगेशन पद्धतीने**:
  - **11-44-11**: 3 किलो/एकर
  - **कॅल्शियम नायट्रेट**: 6 किलो/एकर
  - **सल्फेट ऑफ पोटाश**: 1.5 किलो/एकर
  - **सूचना**: फॉस्फोरिक आम्ल आणि कॅल्शियम नायट्रेट वेगवेगळ्या वेळेस लागू करावेत.

#### आगामी फर्टिगेशन शेड्यूल:
- **सुरूवात**: 8 नोव्हेंबर 2024
- **फोलिअर पद्धतीने**:
  - **जिंक ऑक्साइड**: 200 ग्रॅम/एकर
  - **गिब्बेरलिक आम्ल (GA3)**: 10 ppm

### शंका:
1. पाण्याचे नियोजन योग्य आहे का?
2. कीड आणि रोगांची तपासणी केली आहे का?
3. हवामानाच्या बदलांचा विचार केला आहे का?

आपण या मुद्द्यांवर विचार करून आपल्या उत्पादनात सुधारणा करू शकता. अधिक माहिती हवी असल्यास, कृपया सांगा.

messages.en:
If you don't see up-to-date data in the Kairo or Nero app, please check the following:

1. **Device connection:** Make sure the device is connected to the app.
2. **Network connectivity:** Check if the internet connection is working.
3. *Battery status:** Check that the device's battery is good.
4. **Restart the device:** Restart the device and check again.

If the problem persists even after checking all these things, contact technical assistance.

messages.content: Integration ky ahe
messages.en: Integration ky ahe
messages.standalone_question: What is integration?
messages.standalone_en: What is integration?

messages.content:
Integration म्हणजे दोन किंवा अधिक गोष्टींचा एकत्रितपणे समावेश करणे. कृषी संदर्भात, हे विविध तंत्रज्ञान, साधने, आणि पद्धतींचा एकत्रित वापर करून उत्पादन वाढवणे, संसाधनांचा अधिक प्रभावी वापर करणे, आणि शेतीच्या कार्यक्षमतेत सुधारणा करणे यासाठी वापरले जाते. 

उदाहरणार्थ, सेंसर्स, डेटा अॅनालिटिक्स, आणि स्मार्ट इरिगेशन तंत्रज्ञान यांचा एकत्रित वापर करून शेतकऱ्यांना त्यांच्या पिकांची योग्य काळजी घेण्यास मदत होते.
messages.en:
Integration refers to the inclusion of two or more things together. In the agricultural context, it is used to increase production, make more effective use of resources, and improve agricultural efficiency by combining various technologies, tools, and methods. 

For example, the combined use of sensors, data analytics, and smart irrigation technology can help farmers take proper care of their crops.

messages.standalone_question: What does the red color indicate in a moisture indicator?
messages.standalone_en: What does the red color indicate in a moisture indicator?

faq:
Q: Sensor is showing wet, i.e. less kpa but soil looks dry.
A: The sensor measures the moisture around the rootzone which is not visible from the top. Ask use to check the moisture in rootzone around the sensor. If it matches, ask the user to irrigate.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor values fluctuate?
A: Ensure the sensor is installed properly in the soil, check for air bubbles, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

messages.content: A red color indication in the moisture indicator typically signifies that the soil is dry and requires irrigation. It's essential to check the soil moisture reading from the sensor to confirm this. If the sensor shows a high kPa value (indicating dry soil), you should consider irrigating the plot to ensure your cucumber plants receive adequate moisture. Would you like me to check the current soil moisture reading for your cucumber plots?
messages.en: A red color indication in the moisture indicator typically signifies that the soil is dry and requires irrigation. It's essential to check the soil moisture reading from the sensor to confirm this. If the sensor shows a high kPa value (indicating dry soil), you should consider irrigating the plot to ensure your cucumber plants receive adequate moisture. Would you like me to check the current soil moisture reading for your cucumber plots?

messages.standalone_en: Would you like me to check the current soil moisture reading for your cucumber plots?

tools:
should_i_give_water  
Checks the current and optimal soil moisture values and decides whether the farmer should give water to the plot now or today.

get_soil_moisture_sensor_depth  
Returns the depths in inches of the soil moisture sensors 1 and 2 installed on the plots.

get_soil_moisture_percentage_from_kpa_reading  
Gets the estimated soil moisture percentage for a given plot and kPa reading.
faq:
Q: Sensor is showing wet, i.e. less kpa but soil looks dry.
A: The sensor measures the moisture around the rootzone which is not visible from the top. Ask use to check the moisture in rootzone around the sensor. If it matches, ask the user to irrigate.

Q: How do I know if my soil  moisture sensor is working fine ?
A: The only way to know is if after irrigation the sensor is dropping below 5 kpa and increasing continuously unless next irrigation is done. You can try putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. Also, a soil moisture reading of 0 kPa is perfectly fine, meaning wet soil, but a reading of 200 kPa could mean fault. If the soil moisture sensor reading is consistently at 0 from few 48 hours, then it could be anamolous (use live and historical hourly soil moisture data (use tool) to validate).

Q: The moisture (kpa) is increasing very fast  recently and it is asking to irrigate frequently.
A:  Kpa is increasing fast it means that sensors are drying rapidly.  The chatbot needs to :
Check the actual kpa increase rate if it's higher now  in comparison to the previous weeks. If there no , tell the user that kPa increase is normal.
If there is rapid increase recently, check if the crop stag is near full fruit growth or harvesting. In the later stages , crop transpiration is very high , thus there is a rapid increase in soil moisture Kpa meaning decrease in moisture in the soil. Also, the moisture drop can be due to high evaporation recently. Check if there is temperature increase meaning high evaporation recently.
If the above two are not the cases, ask user to check the moisture physically near the sensor. If the actual moisture is wet near the sensor and the sensor is showing dry, the sensor might be worn out. In this case , ask if the user wants to raise a ticket with the support team.

Q: The moisture (kpa) is increasing slowly recently.
A: Need to check for current stage and evapotranspiration rate. If the crop is recently sown or pruning (छंटाई)  is done recently, the transpiration will be slow and moisture kpa will increase slowly. If evaporation is slow or temperature have dropped on rainfall has happened, it will increase slowly. The chatbot needs to check the temperature , rainfall and crop stage data. And advise if there is any reason for the slow increase.
If still there is some confusion, the chatbot needs to ask user to check moisture around the sensor by digging and then ask  the user if he wants to create an issue ticket for the same.

messages.content:

If the soil is indeed wet near the sensor, then the sensor might be functioning correctly. If it feels dry, the sensor may not be accurately reflecting the moisture levels. Would you like to raise a ticket with the support team to investigate the sensor issue further?

messages.content:
A red color indication in the soil temperature indicator typically signifies that the soil temperature is either too high or too low for optimal crop growth. 

For cucumbers, the ideal soil temperature is generally between 18°C to 24°C (64°F to 75°F). If the temperature is outside this range, it can affect seed germination and plant growth.

Would you like me to check the current soil temperature reading for your cucumber plots?

messages.content:
To raise a maintenance ticket for your device issue, you can follow these steps:

1. **Open the Fyllo App**: Launch the Fyllo application on your device.
2. **Navigate to Support**: Look for a "Support" or "Help" section in the app.
3. **Select Maintenance Ticket**: Choose the option to raise a maintenance ticket or report an issue.
4. **Describe the Issue**: Provide a brief description of the problem you're facing with the soil temperature indicator.
5. **Submit the Ticket**: After filling in the necessary details, submit the ticket.

If you need further assistance or prefer to contact customer support directly, you can find their contact information in the app or on the Fyllo website.

If you would like, I can assist you with any specific details you want to include in the ticket.

messages.content:
If your Sugarcane farm's location is not reflecting properly, please check the following:

1. **Device Settings:** Ensure that the device settings are correctly configured to your plot's location.
2. **GPS Signal:** Make sure the device has a good GPS signal. Sometimes, poor signal can lead to inaccurate location data.
3. **App Update:** Ensure that your Fyllo app is updated to the latest version, as updates may fix location-related issues.
4. **Contact Support:** If the issue persists, please contact Fyllo's customer support for assistance in correcting the location.

Let me know if you need help with anything else!
messages.en:
If your Sugarcane farm's location is not reflecting properly, please check the following:

1. **Device Settings:** Ensure that the device settings are correctly configured to your plot's location.
2. **GPS Signal:** Make sure the device has a good GPS signal. Sometimes, poor signal can lead to inaccurate location data.
3. **App Update:** Ensure that your Fyllo app is updated to the latest version, as updates may fix location-related issues.
4. **Contact Support:** If the issue persists, please contact Fyllo's customer support for assistance in correcting the location.

Let me know if you need help with anything else!

messages.content:

2. **Navigate to Device Settings:** Look for the section that lists your devices. Select your Nero device from the list.

3. **Access Settings:** Within the device details, you should find an option for settings or configuration. Tap on it to access the Nero settings.

4. **Make Adjustments:** Here, you can adjust settings such as location, sensor calibration, and other configurations.

If you encounter any issues or need further assistance, feel free to contact Fyllo's customer support.

messages.content: Whenever I open your app i am getting the message check your internet connection what does this means
messages.en: Whenever I open your app i am getting the message check your internet connection what does this means
messages.standalone_question: What does it mean when I receive a message saying "check your internet connection" every time I open the app?
messages.standalone_en: What does it mean when I receive a message saying "check your internet connection" every time I open the app?

messages.content:
The message "check your internet connection" typically means that the Fyllo app is unable to connect to the internet. Here are some steps you can take to resolve this issue:

1. **Check Wi-Fi or Mobile Data:** Ensure that your device is connected to a stable Wi-Fi network or has mobile data enabled.

2. **Restart Your Device:** Sometimes, simply restarting your smartphone or tablet can resolve connectivity issues.

3. **Check Airplane Mode:** Make sure that Airplane Mode is turned off, as this will disable all network connections.

4. **Update the App:** Ensure that you are using the latest version of the Fyllo app. Check for updates in your app store.

5. **Reinstall the App:** If the problem persists, try uninstalling and then reinstalling the Fyllo app.

If you continue to experience issues, consider reaching out to Fyllo's customer support for further assistance.

messages.content:
તમારા પાક માટે પાણી ચલાવવાની માત્રા જમીનની ભેજની સ્થિતિ પર આધાર રાખે છે. જો જમીનનું ભેજ 0-5 kPa છે, તો તે ભેજવાળી છે અને પાણી આપવાની જરૂર નથી. જો ભેજ 200 kPa કે તેથી વધુ છે, તો જમીન સૂકી છે અને પાણી આપવાની જરૂર છે.

મહિતી માટે, શું તમે મને તમારા પ્લોટનું નામ આપી શકો છો? હું તમને વધુ ચોક્કસ માહિતી આપી શકું.
વાઙીયા મેં બે કલાક પાણી આપ્યું તું પણ ખુબ ભીનુ બતાવે છે
messages.standalone_question: I watered the plants for two hours, but the soil still appears very wet. What should I do?
messages.standalone_en: I watered the plants for two hours, but the soil still appears very wet. What should I do?

faq:
Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor always shows wet values?
A: Verify the irrigation frequency, check the installation point, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is showing dry.
A: Ask user when he irrigated. It usually takes 12 hours to reach the water till sensor. If the sensor is not dropping even after 12 hours, it can be due to one of the following reasons :
Water is not reaching properly till the sensor , this can be due to drip blocked , or slope in the land or dripper outlets far away from the sensor. Ask user to check if drip is fine and  dripper is within the range of sensor. 
The sensor can be very old , more than two years , in this case , the sensor might be malfunction, ask user if he wants to raise a ticket

messages.content:
જો તમે બે કલાક પાણી આપ્યું છે અનેsensor હજુ પણ ભીના મૂલ્યો બતાવે છે, તો આ કેટલીક બાબતોને દર્શાવી શકે છે:

1. **જમીન સુધી પાણી પહોંચવામાં સમય**: પાણી જમીન સુધી પહોંચવામાં અને મૂળ વિસ્તારમાં સેટલ થવામાં 12 કલાક સુધીનો સમય લઈ શકે છે. 

2. **ડ્રિપ સિસ્ટમની તપાસ**: ખાતરી કરો કે ડ્રિપ સિસ્ટમ યોગ્ય રીતે કાર્ય કરી રહી છે. જો કોઈ બ્લોકેજ છે અથવા ડ્રિપર્સ sensor ની નજીક નથી, તો પાણી યોગ્ય રીતે પહોંચતું નથી.

3. **સેન્સરનું કાર્ય**: જો sensor 2 વર્ષથી વધુ જૂનો છે, તો તે ખોટું મૂલ્ય બતાવી શકે છે. 

જો તમને વધુ મદદની જરૂર હોય, તો શું તમે આ સમસ્યાને ઉકેલવા માટે ટિકિટ ઉઠાવવા માંગો છો?
આ મશીન લગાવા થી મનૈ કાંઇ જ ફાયદો નહીં દેખાતૉ

messages.standalone_en: What benefits do you expect from using this machine?

messages.content:
જો તમને મશીન લગાવવાથી કોઈ ફાયદો નથી દેખાતો, તો આ બાબતોને ધ્યાનમાં રાખવું મહત્વપૂર્ણ છે:

1. **સેન્સર ડેટા**: મશીન દ્વારા આપવામાં આવેલી માહિતી અને ડેટા સાચા છે કે નહીં તે તપાસો. જો સેન્સર ખોટા મૂલ્યો બતાવે છે, તો તે યોગ્ય રીતે કાર્ય કરી રહ્યું નથી.

2. **સંચાલન અને જાળવણી**: મશીનની યોગ્ય રીતે જાળવણી અને સંચાલન કરવામાં આવે છે કે નહીં તે તપાસો. જો મશીનમાં કોઈ સમસ્યા છે, તો તે યોગ્ય રીતે કાર્ય કરી શકતું નથી.

3. **ડેટા વિશ્લેષણ**: મશીન દ્વારા આપવામાં આવેલી માહિતીનો યોગ્ય રીતે ઉપયોગ કરવામાં આવે છે કે નહીં તે તપાસો. જો તમે માહિતીનો ઉપયોગ કરીને યોગ્ય નિર્ણય નથી લઈ રહ્યા, તો ફાયદો ઓછો થઈ શકે છે.

4. **કૃષિ પદ્ધતિઓ**: મશીનની માહિતી સાથે તમારી કૃષિ પદ્ધતિઓને સુસંગત બનાવવું મહત્વપૂર્ણ છે. 

જો તમને વધુ મદદની જરૂર હોય, તો કૃપા કરીને વધુ વિગતો આપો, જેથી હું વધુ ચોક્કસ રીતે મદદ કરી શકું.
બટાકા આ સિસ્ટમ લગાવવાથી કેટલું ઉત્પાદનમાં ફરક પડે

messages.content:
બટાકાના પાકમાં Fyllo સિસ્ટમ લગાવવાથી નીચેના ફાયદા થઈ શકે છે:

1. **સચોટ માહિતી**: સિસ્ટમ જમીન અને પાકની સ્થિતિ વિશે સચોટ માહિતી પ્રદાન કરે છે, જે યોગ્ય નિર્ણય લેવા માટે મદદરૂપ થાય છે.

2. **પાણી અને ખાતરનું યોગ્ય ઉપયોગ**: સિસ્ટમ દ્વારા આપવામાં આવેલી માહિતીના આધારે, તમે પાણી અને ખાતરનું યોગ્ય પ્રમાણ આપી શકો છો, જે પાકના વિકાસને પ્રોત્સાહન આપે છે.

3. **રોગ અને કીટક નિયંત્રણ**: સિસ્ટમ રોગ અને કીટકની આગાહી કરી શકે છે, જે સમયસર ઉપાય લેવા માટે મદદરૂપ થાય છે.

4. **ઉત્પાદન વધારવું**: વધુ સચોટ અને સમયસર પગલાં લીધા જવાથી, પાકની ગુણવત્તા અને ઉત્પાદનમાં વધારો થઈ શકે છે.

5. **ખર્ચમાં ઘટાડો**: વધુ અસરકારક રીતે પાણી અને ખાતરનો ઉપયોગ કરીને, તમે ખર્ચમાં ઘટાડો કરી શકો છો.

આ રીતે, Fyllo સિસ્ટમનો ઉપયોગ કરીને, તમે બટાકાના ઉત્પાદનમાં નોંધપાત્ર સુધારો કરી શકો છો.

messages.content:
तुमच्या Fyllo अॅपमध्ये काही पर्याय दिसत नसल्यास, तुम्ही खालील गोष्टी तपासू शकता:

1. **नेटवर्क कनेक्टिव्हिटी**: तुमचा इंटरनेट कनेक्शन चांगला आहे का ते तपासा.
2. **अॅप अपडेट**: अॅप अपडेट केले आहे का ते तपासा. अॅपच्या हॅम्बर्गर मेन्यूमध्ये (≡) जा आणि तिथे अॅप आवृत्ती तपासा.
3. **अॅप रिस्टार्ट करा**: अॅप बंद करून पुन्हा सुरू करा.
4. **डिव्हाइस रिस्टार्ट करा**: तुमच्या फोनला रीस्टार्ट करा.

जर तुम्हाला अजूनही समस्या येत असेल, तर Fyllo च्या ग्राहक समर्थनाशी संपर्क साधा.
messages.en:
If you don't see any options in your Fyllo app, you can check the following:

1. **Network connectivity**: Check if your internet connection is good.
2. **App Update**: Check if the app has been updated. Go to the app's Hamburger menu (≡) and check the app version there.
3. **Restart the app**: Close the app and restart it.
4. **Restart the device**: Restart your phone.

If you're still having a problem, contact Fyllo's customer support.

messages.content:
तुमच्या अपलोड केलेल्या चित्रानुसार, खालील माहिती मिळाली आहे:

- **मातीतील आर्द्रता स्तर (Mati Oolava-1)**: 0% (खूप कमी)
- **मातीतील आर्द्रता स्तर (Mati Oolava-2)**: 0% (खूप कमी)
- **मातीचे तापमान**: 31.06°C (मध्यम)
- **डॅम्पिंग ऑफ (Daani Mildyu)**: 58.31% (मध्यम)
- **मातीची रचना (Bhuri)**: 58.31% (मध्यम)
- **कर्ण**: डेटा स्पष्टपणे दिसत नाही.

आर्द्रता स्तर अत्यंत कमी आहे, ज्यामुळे पिकांच्या आरोग्यावर नकारात्मक परिणाम होऊ शकतो. मातीतील आर्द्रता सुधारण्यासाठी जलसिंचन किंवा इतर उपाययोजना करणे आवश्यक आहे. तापमान सामान्य श्रेणीत आहे, परंतु मध्यम डॅम्पिंग ऑफ आणि मातीची रचना संभाव्य समस्यांचे संकेत देतात.

जलसिंचन धोरणे लागू करण्याचा विचार करा आणि मातीच्या आरोग्य सुधारण्यासाठी कदाचित मातीचे सुधारणा करणे आवश्यक आहे.
messages.en:

- **Soil moisture level (Mati Oolava-1)**: 0% (very low)
- **Soil moisture level (Mati Oolava-2)**: 0% (very low)
- **Soil temperature**: 31.06°C (moderate)
- **Damping Off (Daani Mildyu)**: 58.31% (medium)
- **Soil composition (Bhuri)**: 58.31% (medium)
- *****: The data is not clearly visible.

Humidity levels are extremely low, which can negatively affect the health of crops. Irrigation or other measures need to be taken to improve soil moisture. Temperatures are in the normal range, but moderate dumping off and soil composition indicate potential problems.

Consider implementing irrigation policies, and soil improvements are probably necessary to improve soil health.

messages.content:
કાળે ૧ કલાક irrigation આપ્યા પછી, 12 કલાક સુધી રાહ જોવું જોઈએ, કારણ કે પાણીને સેન્સર સુધી પહોંચવામાં સમય લાગે છે. 

જો સેન્સર 0 થી 5 kPa વચ્ચે છે, તો તે ભેજવાળું માનવામાં આવે છે. 0 kPa એટલે કે જમીન સંપૂર્ણપણે ભેજવાળી છે. 

તમે ચકાસી શકો છો કે ડ્રિપ સિસ્ટમ યોગ્ય રીતે કાર્ય કરી રહી છે કે નહીં, અને જો સેન્સર 2 વર્ષથી વધુ જૂનો છે, તો તે ખોટો પણ હોઈ શકે છે. શું તમે ટેકનિકલ સહાય માટે ટિકિટ ઉઠાવવી ઇચ્છો છો?
messages.en:
After giving 1 hour of irrigation, one should wait for 12 hours, as it takes time for the water to reach the sensor. 

If the sensor is between 0 and 5 kPa, it is considered humid. 0 kPa i.e. the land is completely moist. 

You can check if the drip system is working properly, and if the sensor is more than 2 years old, it may even be wrong. Would you like to pick up a ticket for technical assistance?

messages.content: સેન્સર બે વર્ષ નથી થયા
messages.en: It's not been two years since the censors
messages.standalone_question: Is the sensor less than two years old?
messages.standalone_en: Is the sensor less than two years old?

messages.content:
જો સેન્સર બે વર્ષથી જૂનો નથી, તો શક્ય છે કે પાણી સેન્સર સુધી યોગ્ય રીતે ન પહોંચતું હોય. આ માટે નીચેની બાબતો ચકાસો:

1. **ડ્રિપ સિસ્ટમ**: ચકાસો કે ડ્રિપ સિસ્ટમ બ્લોક થયેલ નથી. 
2. **સેન્સરનું સ્થાન**: ખાતરી કરો કે સેન્સર જમીનમાં યોગ્ય રીતે સ્થાપિત છે અને તે જમીનના ભેજને માપી રહ્યું છે.
3. **ડ્રિપરનું અંતર**: જો ડ્રિપર સેન્સરથી દૂર છે, તો પાણી ત્યાં સુધી પહોંચતું નથી.

જો આ બધું ઠીક છે અને સેન્સર હજુ પણ ખોટું વાંચી રહ્યું છે, તો શું તમે ટેકનિકલ સહાય માટે ટિકિટ ઉઠાવવી ઇચ્છો છો?
messages.en:
If the sensor is not two years old, it is possible that the water does not reach the sensor properly. Check out the following for this:

1. **Drip System**: Check that the drip system is not blocked. 
2. **Location of sensor**: Make sure that the sensor is properly installed in the ground and it is measuring the moisture of the soil.
3. **The distance of the dripper**: If the dripper is away from the sensor, the water does not reach there.

If all this is fine and the censor is still misreading, would you like to pick up a ticket for technical help?

faq:
Q: In the latest irrigation , sensor didn't drop to 0.
A: 0 to 5 Kpa means soil is fully wet. It need not drop to 0 every time. Moisture less than 5 also means wet conditions. So, need not worry. Also ask to wait for 12 hours after irrigation.

messages.content:
જો ફુવારા કાંટા બરાબર બતાવે છે, તો તે સારું સંકેત છે કે સેન્સર યોગ્ય રીતે કાર્ય કરી રહ્યું છે. 

જો તમે irrigation કર્યા પછી સેન્સર 0 થી 5 kPa વચ્ચે છે, તો તે ભેજવાળું માનવામાં આવે છે. 0 kPa એટલે કે જમીન સંપૂર્ણપણે ભેજવાળી છે. 

તમે 12 કલાક રાહ જોવું જોઈએ, કારણ કે પાણીને જમીન સુધી પહોંચવામાં સમય લાગે છે. જો 12 કલાક પછી પણ સેન્સરનું વાંચન 5 kPa થી વધુ છે, તો તમે જમીનની આસપાસના વિસ્તારમાં ભેજ ચકાસી શકો છો. 

જો જમીન ખરેખર સૂકી લાગે છે, તો irrigation ફરીથી આપવાની જરૂર પડી શકે છે.
messages.en:
If the fountain fork shows exactly, it is a good sign that the sensor is working properly. 

If the sensor is between 0 and 5 kPa after you have irrigated, it is considered to be humid. 0 kPa i.e. the land is completely moist. 

You should wait for 12 hours, as it takes time for the water to reach the ground. If the sensor's reading is more than 5 kPa even after 12 hours, you can check the humidity in the area around the ground. 

If the land looks really dry, irrigation may need to be given again.

faq:
Q: When should I water? (Hindi: Paani kab dun?)
A: 0-5 kPa is wet, and increasing kPa means increasing dryness. The crop should stay in its optimal moisture zone, and when very close or above the dry optimal moisture, water can be given. Check internal irrigation forecast for the correct answer.

Q: How much to irrigate after receiving notification?
A: The net quantity of water to be applied depends on the moisture deficit in the soil, leaching requirement, and expectancy of rainfall. When no rainfall is expected and the soil is not saline, the net quantity equals the moisture deficit in the soil.

faq:
Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

Q: How to calibrate soil moisture sensors ?
A:  The way to calibrate sensors is by putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. A drop after watering or irrigation and continuous dry upto 200 kpa means that the sensor is calibrated.

Q: Sensor is showing wet, i.e. less kpa but soil looks dry.
A: The sensor measures the moisture around the rootzone which is not visible from the top. Ask use to check the moisture in rootzone around the sensor. If it matches, ask the user to irrigate.

Q: My  sensor is showing 0 Kpa for long.
A: 0-5 kPa means wet soil. It can be due to following :
If the device is recently installed, there can be moisture  around the sensor because the sensor is dipped in the water before installing. If this is the case, ask them to do atleast 3 irrigations as per their previous schedule without sensors and sensors would b set by then.
If the crop stage is very early or pruing is done recently, the water takeup by plants is negligible in this period because of very less transpiration. If this is the case, ask them to wait till irrigation Kpa in the present stage.
Sometimes, the water can remain accumulated around the sensor due to local landscaping or slope in the land around sensor. In this case, please check the around the sensor. It will have to be reinstalled properly. Chatbot should ask the user if he wants to create an issue ticket for the same

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is showing dry.
A: Ask user when he irrigated. It usually takes 12 hours to reach the water till sensor. If the sensor is not dropping even after 12 hours, it can be due to one of the following reasons :
Water is not reaching properly till the sensor , this can be due to drip blocked , or slope in the land or dripper outlets far away from the sensor. Ask user to check if drip is fine and  dripper is within the range of sensor. 
The sensor can be very old , more than two years , in this case , the sensor might be malfunction, ask user if he wants to raise a ticket

Q: How do I set up sensors for Kairo?
A: Place soil moisture sensors in water for about 30 minutes before starting the device.

Q: Sensor is showing wet, i.e. less kpa but soil looks dry.
A: The sensor measures the moisture around the rootzone which is not visible from the top. Ask use to check the moisture in rootzone around the sensor. If it matches, ask the user to irrigate.

Q: How can the sensor monitor the whole plot when it's installed near one plant?
A: The installation process includes a detailed survey of the plot regarding variations in soil type and root zone. A point for installation is selected with a plant of average growth representing the whole plot.

faq:
Q: How to calibrate soil moisture sensors ?
A:  The way to calibrate sensors is by putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. A drop after watering or irrigation and continuous dry upto 200 kpa means that the sensor is calibrated.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor values fluctuate?
A: Ensure the sensor is installed properly in the soil, check for air bubbles, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor always shows dry values?
A: Check if irrigation water is reaching the sensor, verify sensor connection, and ensure the sensor is not damaged.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor always shows wet values?
A: Verify the irrigation frequency, check the installation point, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

तुमच्या "Guava plot no 1" मध्ये दोन्ही सेन्सरची आर्द्रता वेगळी आहे, त्यामुळे तुम्हाला पाण्याची गरज समजून घेण्यासाठी खालील गोष्टी लक्षात घ्या:

### सध्याची आर्द्रता:
- **सेन्सर 1:** 73% आर्द्रता
- **सेन्सर 2:** 95% आर्द्रता

### पाण्याची गरज:
- **सेन्सर 1** च्या आर्द्रतेची पातळी 73% आहे, जी आदर्श पातळीपेक्षा जास्त आहे.
- **सेन्सर 2** च्या आर्द्रतेची पातळी 95% आहे, जी देखील आदर्श पातळीपेक्षा जास्त आहे.

### पाण्याचे वितरण:
1. **पाण्याची गरज नाही:** सध्या दोन्ही सेन्सरच्या आर्द्रतेची पातळी 60% पेक्षा जास्त आहे, त्यामुळे तुम्हाला पाणी देण्याची आवश्यकता नाही.
2. **पाण्याचे वितरण:** जर तुम्हाला पाणी द्यायचे असेल, तर तुम्ही सेन्सर 1 च्या आर्द्रतेवर लक्ष केंद्रित करू शकता, कारण ती कमी आहे. 

### पुढील पाऊले:
- **पाणी देताना:** तुम्ही पाणी देताना सेन्सर 1 च्या आर्द्रतेवर लक्ष ठेवा. पाणी देण्याच्या नंतर, 12 तासांपर्यंत थांबा आणि नंतर सेन्सरच्या वाचनाची पुन्हा तपासणी करा.
- **नियमित तपासणी:** नियमितपणे दोन्ही सेन्सरच्या वाचनांची तपासणी करा, जेणेकरून तुम्हाला पाण्याची गरज कधी भासेल हे समजेल.

जर तुम्हाला आणखी काही शंका असतील, तर कृपया विचारा!

faq:
Q: How to measure/ calculate irrigation hours /water tank of my plot in fyllo app? How do I calculate irrigation hours for my plot? How to use the irrigation hours calculator?
A: To calculate irrigation hours in the Fyllo app, follow these steps:

1. Open the Fyllo App
2. Go to the home screen
3. Click on the soil moisture-1 sensor
4. Scroll down to find the "Irrigation hours" section
5. Fill in the required details such as:
   - Root width (inches)
   - Root depth (inches)
   - Soil retention (mm)
   - Dripper distance (feet)
   - Dripper discharge (liters)
6. Click the calculate button

Would you like me to calculate the irrigation hours for you right now? I can retrieve your plot's irrigation settings and perform the calculation if you say yes.

Tool Selection: When user says yes, I should:
1. Use get_irrigation_installation_settings tool to retrieve plot settings
2. Check if all values are present and valid
3. If values are valid, use calculate_irrigation_hours tool with these values
4. If values are missing or invalid, ask the user to provide the missing values
5. After calculating irrigation hours, display the irrigation installation settings that were used for the calculation
6. Ask the user if they want to calculate irrigation hours with a different set of values, and if yes, prompt them to provide those values

Example response if values are missing:
"I checked your plot settings, but I need some additional information to calculate irrigation hours accurately. Could you please provide the [missing value(s)]? Once you provide these details, I can complete the calculation for you."

Example response after calculation:
"Based on your plot's irrigation settings, the calculated irrigation hours are [X] hours. 

I used the following settings for this calculation:
- Root width: [value] inches
- Root depth: [value] inches
- Soil retention: [value] mm
- Dripper distance: [value] feet
- Dripper discharge: [value] liters

Would you like to calculate irrigation hours with a different set of values? If yes, please provide the new values you'd like to use."

Q: How can the sensor monitor the whole plot when it's installed near one plant?
A: The installation process includes a detailed survey of the plot regarding variations in soil type and root zone. A point for installation is selected with a plant of average growth representing the whole plot.

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

faq:
Q: What is ETO?
A: ETO stands for Evapotranspiration, which is the sum of evaporation and transpiration where water moves from the leaf surface and land surface to the atmosphere. The irrigation requirement and frequency are indirectly related to ETO.

messages.content: What is fyllo

messages.standalone_question: What is Fyllo?
messages.standalone_en: What is Fyllo?

faq:
Q: How does the Fyllo device work?
A: The Fyllo device captures data from 11 sensors at regular intervals. This data is then analyzed using Fyllo's Weather & Agronomical Algorithms to provide alerts to farmers for disease & pest management, irrigation management, fertigation management, and weather prediction.

Q: What makes Fyllo different from its competitors?
A: Fyllo differentiates itself through:
 - Precision & accuracy due to unique installation and sensor positioning.
 - Agronomical Algorithms created by a team of scientists led by Dr. Shikhamany, who is considered by many as the father of Indian grape industry.
 - 100% customer retention: Fyllo is known for its service on the ground, 24-hour issue resolution.
 - User-friendly interface that's easy to understand for all language and age group users.

Q: What is the Fyllo's accuracy?
A: Our all agronomical algorithms and insights have an accuracy of 95%.

Q: How do I contact customer support for Fyllo?
A: You can contact customer support by calling the helpline number at (+91) 9380908040 or by emailing contact@fyllo.in. Do you want me to raise a support ticket for you?

Q: How can I trust that Fyllo's fertigation schedule is accurate?

tools:
should_i_give_water  
Checks the current and optimal soil moisture values and decides whether the farmer should give water to the plot now or today.

get_soil_moisture_sensor_depth  
Returns the depths in inches of the soil moisture sensors 1 and 2 installed on the plots.
faq:
Q: Sensor is showing wet, i.e. less kpa but soil looks dry.
A: The sensor measures the moisture around the rootzone which is not visible from the top. Ask use to check the moisture in rootzone around the sensor. If it matches, ask the user to irrigate.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor always shows dry values?
A: Check if irrigation water is reaching the sensor, verify sensor connection, and ensure the sensor is not damaged.

Q: Sensor is showing dry, but it rained recently.
A: Rainwater doesn't percolate well in the soil. Most of it runs off. After a day of rain stops , if the sensor is still dry, you will have to irrigate. You can check the moisture by digging near the sensor . Irrigate accordingly.

Q: How do I know if my soil  moisture sensor is working fine ?
A: The only way to know is if after irrigation the sensor is dropping below 5 kpa and increasing continuously unless next irrigation is done. You can try putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. Also, a soil moisture reading of 0 kPa is perfectly fine, meaning wet soil, but a reading of 200 kPa could mean fault. If the soil moisture sensor reading is consistently at 0 from few 48 hours, then it could be anamolous (use live and historical hourly soil moisture data (use tool) to validate).

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor values fluctuate?
A: Ensure the sensor is installed properly in the soil, check for air bubbles, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

messages.content:
The second soil moisture sensor in "plot no 1" is showing a reading of 27 kPa, which indicates that the soil is quite dry. 

Here are a few steps you can take:

1. **Check Irrigation**: Ensure that irrigation water is reaching the sensor area. If you recently irrigated, it may take some time for the moisture to reach the sensor.

2. **Inspect Drip System**: Check for any blockages in the drip system or if the dripper outlets are too far from the sensor. 

3. **Verify Sensor Condition**: If the sensor is older than two years, it might be malfunctioning. 

4. **Digging Test**: You can also dig near the sensor to check the moisture level in the root zone.

If the sensor continues to show dry values after these checks, please let me know if you would like to raise a ticket for a sensor malfunction.

messages.content: How to change simcard
messages.en: How to change simcard
messages.standalone_question: How do I change the SIM card in the device?
messages.standalone_en: How do I change the SIM card in the device?

messages.content:
To change the SIM card in your Fyllo device (like the NERO_INFINITY_UNIT), follow these steps:

1. **Power Off the Device**: Ensure that the device is turned off before you begin the process.

2. **Locate the SIM Card Slot**: Find the SIM card slot on the device. This is usually accessible from the back or side of the unit.

3. **Remove the Old SIM Card**: 
   - If there is a cover, gently remove it.
   - Use a small tool (like a SIM ejector tool or a paperclip) to push the SIM card tray out.
   - Carefully take out the old SIM card.

4. **Insert the New SIM Card**: 
   - Place the new SIM card into the tray, ensuring it is oriented correctly (usually with the gold contacts facing down).
   - Push the tray back into the device until it clicks into place.

5. **Power On the Device**: Turn the device back on and check if it is connecting to the network.

6. **Test the Connection**: Ensure that the device is actively sending data by checking the app or dashboard.

If you encounter any issues during this process, please refer to the user manual or contact Fyllo support for assistance.

messages.content: How the sensor works
messages.en: How the sensor works
messages.standalone_question: How does the sensor work?
messages.standalone_en: How does the sensor work?

messages.content:
Soil moisture sensors work by measuring the volumetric water content in the soil. Here's a brief overview of how they function:

1. **Measurement Principle**: Most soil moisture sensors use one of two main principles:
   - **Capacitive Sensors**: These measure the dielectric constant of the soil, which changes with moisture content. The sensor emits an electromagnetic field, and the amount of moisture affects the capacitance, which is then converted into a moisture reading.
   - **Resistive Sensors**: These measure the electrical resistance between two probes inserted into the soil. The resistance decreases as moisture increases, allowing the sensor to determine the soil moisture level.

2. **Data Transmission**: The sensor collects data on soil moisture levels and transmits this information to a central system or cloud platform via a SIM card or wireless connection.

3. **Real-Time Monitoring**: The data is processed and displayed in real-time, allowing farmers to monitor soil moisture levels continuously. This helps in making informed irrigation decisions.

4. **Alerts and Notifications**: Many systems can send alerts when soil moisture levels fall below or rise above certain thresholds, helping farmers take timely action.

5. **Calibration**: Sensors may need to be calibrated to ensure accurate readings based on the specific soil type and conditions in the field.

By providing accurate soil moisture data, these sensors help optimize irrigation practices, conserve water, and improve crop yields. If you have more specific questions about your sensor or its operation, feel free to ask!

messages.content: What if someone stole
messages.en: What if someone stole
messages.standalone_question: What should I do if someone stole my sensor?
messages.standalone_en: What should I do if someone stole my sensor?

messages.content:
If your Fyllo device or sensors are stolen, here are the steps you should take:

1. **Report the Theft**: Immediately report the theft to your local authorities. Provide them with details about the stolen equipment, including serial numbers and any identifying information.

2. **Contact Fyllo Support**: Reach out to Fyllo customer support to inform them about the theft. They may be able to assist you in tracking the device if it has GPS capabilities or provide guidance on how to secure your account.

3. **Change Account Credentials**: If your device was connected to an account, change your login credentials to prevent unauthorized access.

4. **Insurance Claim**: If you have insurance coverage for your agricultural equipment, contact your insurance provider to file a claim for the stolen items.

5. **Prevent Future Thefts**: Consider implementing security measures such as surveillance cameras, alarms, or securing devices in locked enclosures to prevent future thefts.

If you need assistance with any of these steps, feel free to ask!

Agar in sab ke baad bhi problem hai, toh aap customer support se sampark kar sakte hain.

messages.standalone_question: Is the soil dry?
messages.standalone_en: Is the soil dry?

faq:
Q: Sensor is showing dry, but it rained recently.
A: Rainwater doesn't percolate well in the soil. Most of it runs off. After a day of rain stops , if the sensor is still dry, you will have to irrigate. You can check the moisture by digging near the sensor . Irrigate accordingly.

Q: Sensor is showing wet, i.e. less kpa but soil looks dry.
A: The sensor measures the moisture around the rootzone which is not visible from the top. Ask use to check the moisture in rootzone around the sensor. If it matches, ask the user to irrigate.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor always shows dry values?
A: Check if irrigation water is reaching the sensor, verify sensor connection, and ensure the sensor is not damaged.

Q: When should I water? (Hindi: Paani kab dun?)
A: 0-5 kPa is wet, and increasing kPa means increasing dryness. The crop should stay in its optimal moisture zone, and when very close or above the dry optimal moisture, water can be given. Check internal irrigation forecast for the correct answer.

messages.content:
જો તમારું Fyllo એપ્લિકેશન બીજાં મોબાઈલમાં અપડેટ થયું છે અને તમારા મોબાઈલમાં નથી, તો તમે નીચેના પગલાંઓ અનુસરી શકો છો:

1. **એપ્લિકેશન ચકાસો**: Fyllo એપ્લિકેશનને ખોલો અને હમણાંના અપડેટ્સ માટે તપાસો.
2. **નેટવર્ક કનેક્શન**: ખાતરી કરો કે તમારા મોબાઈલમાં ઇન્ટરનેટ કનેક્શન સારો છે.
3. **એપ્લિકેશનને રિસ્ટાર્ટ કરો**: એપ્લિકેશનને બંધ કરો અને ફરીથી ખોલો.
4. **મોબાઈલને રિસ્ટાર્ટ કરો**: તમારા મોબાઈલને પુનઃપ્રારંભ કરો.
5. **એપ્લિકેશનને અપડેટ કરો**: Google Play Store અથવા Apple App Store માં જાઓ અને Fyllo એપ્લિકેશનને શોધો. જો અપડેટ ઉપલબ્ધ હોય, તો તેને અપડેટ કરો.

જો આ પગલાંઓ પછી પણ સમસ્યા યથાવત રહે, તો કૃપા કરીને ગ્રાહક સપોર્ટને સંપર્ક કરો:
- ફોન દ્વારા: (+91) 9380908040
- ઇમેઇલ દ્વારા: contact@fyllo.in

આ રીતે, તમે વધુ મદદ મેળવી શકો છો.
messages.en:
If your Fyllo app has been updated to another mobile and not in your mobile, you can follow the following steps:

1. **Check app**: Open the Fyllo app and check for updates now.
2. **Network connection**: Make sure your mobile has a good internet connection.
3. **Restart the app**: Close the app and reopen.
4. **Restart Mobile**: Restart your mobile.
5. **Update the app**: Go to the Google Play Store or Apple App Store and find the Fyllo app. If an update is available, update it.

If the problem persists even after these steps, please contact customer support:
By phone: (+91) 9380908040
- By email: contact@fyllo.in

This way, you can get more help.

આજ દાડમના પ્લોટમાં પાણી ચલાવવાની શ્રેષ્ઠ સમયસૂચી નીચે મુજબ છે:

1. **પ્લોટ 4 (Pantiya, Anjar)**: આજે સવારે 8:44 વાગ્યે પાણી ચલાવવું જોઈએ, કારણ કે વરસાદની અપેક્ષા નથી.
   
2. **પ્લોટ 2 (Lohariya Nana, Anjar)**: આજે સવારે 1:41 વાગ્યે પાણી ચલાવવું જોઈએ, કારણ કે વરસાદની અપેક્ષા નથી.

તમે આ સમય મુજબ પાણી ચલાવી શકો છો.

tools:
should_i_give_water  
Checks the current and optimal soil moisture values and decides whether the farmer should give water to the plot now or today.
faq:
Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: How to measure/ calculate irrigation hours /water tank of my plot in fyllo app? How do I calculate irrigation hours for my plot? How to use the irrigation hours calculator?
A: To calculate irrigation hours in the Fyllo app, follow these steps:

1. Open the Fyllo App
2. Go to the home screen
3. Click on the soil moisture-1 sensor
4. Scroll down to find the "Irrigation hours" section
5. Fill in the required details such as:
   - Root width (inches)
   - Root depth (inches)
   - Soil retention (mm)
   - Dripper distance (feet)
   - Dripper discharge (liters)
6. Click the calculate button

Would you like me to calculate the irrigation hours for you right now? I can retrieve your plot's irrigation settings and perform the calculation if you say yes.

Tool Selection: When user says yes, I should:
1. Use get_irrigation_installation_settings tool to retrieve plot settings
2. Check if all values are present and valid
3. If values are valid, use calculate_irrigation_hours tool with these values
4. If values are missing or invalid, ask the user to provide the missing values
5. After calculating irrigation hours, display the irrigation installation settings that were used for the calculation
6. Ask the user if they want to calculate irrigation hours with a different set of values, and if yes, prompt them to provide those values

Example response if values are missing:
"I checked your plot settings, but I need some additional information to calculate irrigation hours accurately. Could you please provide the [missing value(s)]? Once you provide these details, I can complete the calculation for you."

Example response after calculation:
"Based on your plot's irrigation settings, the calculated irrigation hours are [X] hours. 

I used the following settings for this calculation:
- Root width: [value] inches
- Root depth: [value] inches
- Soil retention: [value] mm
- Dripper distance: [value] feet
- Dripper discharge: [value] liters

Would you like to calculate irrigation hours with a different set of values? If yes, please provide the new values you'd like to use."

Q: How much to irrigate after receiving notification?
A: The net quantity of water to be applied depends on the moisture deficit in the soil, leaching requirement, and expectancy of rainfall. When no rainfall is expected and the soil is not saline, the net quantity equals the moisture deficit in the soil.

Q: When should I water? (Hindi: Paani kab dun?)
A: 0-5 kPa is wet, and increasing kPa means increasing dryness. The crop should stay in its optimal moisture zone, and when very close or above the dry optimal moisture, water can be given. Check internal irrigation forecast for the correct answer.

Agar aapka motor ka light raat ko hai, toh aapko raat ke samay paani dene ke liye motor ka istemal karna chahiye. Yeh paani dene ka ek achha samay hai, kyunki isse paani zyada samay tak zameen mein rahega aur evaporation kam hoga.

12:61:0 can mix with mgso4 in single water tank
messages.en: 12:61:0 can mix with mgso4 in single water tank
messages.standalone_question: Can 12:61:0 be mixed with MgSO4 in a single water tank?
messages.standalone_en: Can 12:61:0 be mixed with MgSO4 in a single water tank?

messages.content:
Mixing fertilizers like 12:61:0 (which is high in phosphorus) with magnesium sulfate (MgSO4) can be done, but it's essential to check for compatibility. Generally, these two can be mixed, but it's advisable to conduct a small compatibility test first. 

For precise guidance tailored to your situation, please consult Fyllo’s CRM number for personalized advice.

faq:
Q: How do I contact customer support for Fyllo?
A: You can contact customer support by calling the helpline number at (+91) 9380908040 or by emailing contact@fyllo.in. Do you want me to raise a support ticket for you?

Q: What makes Fyllo different from its competitors?
A: Fyllo differentiates itself through:
 - Precision & accuracy due to unique installation and sensor positioning.
 - Agronomical Algorithms created by a team of scientists led by Dr. Shikhamany, who is considered by many as the father of Indian grape industry.
 - 100% customer retention: Fyllo is known for its service on the ground, 24-hour issue resolution.
 - User-friendly interface that's easy to understand for all language and age group users.

Q: What is the Fyllo's accuracy?
A: Our all agronomical algorithms and insights have an accuracy of 95%.

Q: How can I reset or restart the Fyllo crop stage on the app?
A: For Hindi instructions, please watch this video: [फसल की स्टेज कैसे अपडेट करे ?](https://youtu.be/Gx2XUOGqNoA) (Thumbnail: https://img.youtube.com/vi/Gx2XUOGqNoA/mqdefault.jpg). For English instructions, please watch this video: [How to update crop stages in App?](https://youtu.be/knCXf0vdN7k) (Thumbnail: https://img.youtube.com/vi/knCXf0vdN7k/mqdefault.jpg). For additional info, contact the CRM team: You can contact customer support by calling the helpline number at (+91) 9380908040 or by emailing contact@fyllo.in.
Make sure to give both hindi and english links.

Q: How does the Fyllo device work?
A: The Fyllo device captures data from 11 sensors at regular intervals. This data is then analyzed using Fyllo's Weather & Agronomical Algorithms to provide alerts to farmers for disease & pest management, irrigation management, fertigation management, and weather prediction.
